comment._content: Must be Jules Védrines (1881-1919), some biographic information here and here. I don't see a Wikipedia article.

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: This picture can be eactly dated: September 9, 1912. Jules Vedrines - the French flyer - turns here one of the pylons in the James Gordon Bennett Cup Race held in Chicago. Vedrines flew the Deperdussin Monocoque racer (1912 model) with a Gnome 14-cylinder rotary engine of 140 - 160 hp. Competition was low, only two other machine was flying (a Hanriot monoplane) flown by Andre Frey and another Deperdussin monoplane flown by Prévost. Prevost finished and became sewcond, Frey got engine trouble and did not reach the finish. Vedrines beat during the race the wrold speed record, setting the worls speed record for 20 km (12.4 miles) covering the distance in 6 min. 56 sec. at a speed of 107 mph. Source: Reed Kinert. Racing planes and air races. Volume 1
